alert.note: Alert for Butler (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 04 at 7:59PM CST until March 05 at 12:30PM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Black River at Poplar Bluff. .The Black River at Poplar Bluff crested earlier today and has started to fall. It is forecast to fall below flood stage Sunday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River at Poplar Bluff. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Farmland south of Poplar Bluff floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CST Saturday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM CST Saturday was 17.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 6.4 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
